title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations:

For Task A, the response must correctly describe an action a legislature in a parliamentary system can take to limit executive power.

For Task B, the response must correctly explain how a presidential system could lead

to an inefficient legislative process.

For Task C, the response must correctly explain why the legislative process is often less efficient in a presidential system than in a parliamentary system.

For Task D, the response must correctly explain how legislative efficiency affects political efficacy in democratic systems.

Points for each task are earned independently of each other.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question.
